name: INSOMNIA
description: Inability to sleep makes people irritable and less productive.

name: PARANOIA
description: Irrational delusions and mental symptoms. Victims distrust of others makes them unlikely to seek treatment.

name: PARALYSIS
description: Pathogen destroys motor neurons to cause paralysis. Significantly harder to cure and can be lethal.

name: COMA
description: Neuropathic effects in the brain stem cause loss of consciousness and sometimes death. Harder to cure.

name: ABSCESSES
description: Pockets of infected flesh are painful and act as breeding grounds for the pathogen.

name: INFLAMMATION
description: Inflammation obstructs bodily processes. Swelling can obstruct breathing and be fatal.

name: CYSTS
description: Painful lumps containing pockets of the pathogen. Slight chance of bursting which can spread disease.

name: NAUSEA
description: Irritated stomach lining leads to discomfort. Slight chance of infection when kissing.

name: COUGHING
description: Chance of infection by spreading pathogen into surroundings, especially in high density, urban areas.

name: RASH
description: The skin becomes blistered and painful, slightly increasing infectivity.

name: HAEMOPHILIA
description: Immune system produces inhibitors that destroy factor VIII, preventing blood clotting. Infectivity increased.

name: ANAEMIA
description: Decrease in red blood cells or haemoglobin in the blood can lead to hypoxia in the organs.

name: NECROSIS
description: Large swathes of infected tissue lose blood supply and become fatal sources of gangrene.

name: SKIN LESIONS
description: Breakdown in the epidermis causes large open wounds which significantly increase infectivity.
